text: I don't want people to acknowledge the superiority of Julia over every programming language of the past, because it's not necessarily superior to all those, I just want people to acknowledge it's superiority to Python, to which it is superior (at least for everything that you would never consider doing in a bash script :wink:)

text: there's a lot of out of the box ML where python is still way better. I believe Julia will get there, but it's management of GPU memory currently isn't nearly as good as python.

elements.text: there's a lot of out of the box ML where python is still way better. I believe Julia will get there, but it's management of GPU memory currently isn't nearly as good as python.

text: Does python actually even do that? Or does it make a call to C or FORTRAN or whatever? I genuinely want to know.

elements.text: Does python actually even do that? Or does it make a call to C or FORTRAN or whatever? I genuinely want to know.

text: or "it's management of GPU memory currently isn't nearly as good as the C/C++/CUDA libraries that Python calls" :smile:

text: 100% true, but from a user experience it means pytorch will let me run bigger resnets than anything Julia has at the moment
